column1: Spring Hill is a city in Maury and Williamson counties
column3: located approximately 30 miles (48 km) south of Nashville. Spring Hill's population as of 2019 was 43
column4: 769. Spring Hill is included in the Nashville metropolitan area.

column1: The first settlers of Spring Hill arrived in 1808 and the city was established in 1809. Albert Russell was the first person to build a home on the land that became Spring Hill.
Spring Hill was the site of a Civil War battle
column2: now known as the Battle of Spring Hill
Spring Hill was the home of a preparatory school
column4: the campus of which now serves as the main campus of Tennessee Children's Home
column5: a ministry associated with the Churches of Christ.

column1: Spring Hill was the site of the Saturn Corporation production facility
column2: which operated from 1990 to 2007. The Saturn S-Series
column4: and Saturn VUE were produced there. In 2007
column7: shut down the facility to retool it for production of other GM vehicles and renamed it Spring Hill Manufacturing. The plant reopened in February 2008 and became the assembly point for the new Chevrolet Traverse. However
column8: after a battle among plants in Spring Hill
column13: 2009 that they had chosen to build a new small car in Orion Township.  Nearly 2
column14: 500 Spring Hill auto workers were faced with lay-off
column15: buy-out and early retirement. The vehicle assembly part of the Spring Hill plant was idled in late 2009 when production of the Traverse was moved to Lansing
column17: while production of power trains and metal stamping continued. In November 2011
column18: GM announced plans for retooling of the vehicle assembly portion of the plant for use as an "ultra-flexible" plant which will initially be used to build the Chevy Equinox and GMC Terrain but will be designed for rapid retooling to other vehicles of similar size.Spring Hill has gone through rapid development and growth in recent years
column19: causing General Motors to reopen their auto plant and begin hiring locally again
column22: companies such as Ryder and Goodwill have announced new facilities in the Spring Hill area.

column1: Spring Hill is run by a mayor elected at-large and a board of eight alderman.
The city is served by both Maury County Public Schools and the Williamson County School District.
Interstate 65 passes through the eastern part of the city
column2: but the only exit currently within city limits is State Route 396. An interchange on the north side of the city at an extended Buckner Road is scheduled to open in 2024. State Route 396
column4: provides an east-west freeway connection into the city with two exits before terminating at Beechcroft Road near the GM plant. U.S. Route 31 is the main north-south arterial through Spring Hill. It is alternatively called both Columbia Pike on the north side of town and Nashville Highway on the south side. State Route 247 is a major east-west road through the city.
